page.title: 12Industry, Local Cotton Mills
page.content: There are lots of mills in Hollinwood. The mills were built for cotton spinning. Most of them were built about a century ago. There are no mills still spinning cotton in Hollinwood today. Devon Mill was built in 1908. It has four floors and a ground floor. A mail-order compay moved in over ten years ago. Devon Mill is like a big shop They don't make things. They pack them and send them all over the country. The jobs that people do in the mill are office work, packing, checking and cleaning. In Brook Mill the Trendsetter Quilt Company occupy the top three floors. They make sleeping bags, pillows and quilts. There are five floors and a basement in the mill. Around eighty people work there. The jobs people do are sewing, trimming, inspection, packing and despatch.
